revised_title: The Caytoniales: A New Group of Angiospermous Plants from Jurassic Rocks of Yorkshire
tldr: The author discovered fossils of a new group of angiospermous plants called Caytoniales in Jurassic rocks of Yorkshire. These plants provide valuable information about the early evolution of angiosperms and their possible origin in the Mesozoic era. The author also developed a new technique for studying the internal structure of these fossils, which has potential for future paleobotanical research.
